title: Jameela Jamil remains unapologetic for not knowing about George Bush’s history
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Jameela Jamil has remained unapologetic for not knowing about George Bush’s history surrounding the Iraq war.

The 33-year-old recently took to Twitter where she defended Ellen DeGeneres for her friendship with the former president.

After photos emerged of the self-proclaimed liberal laughing away with the former Republican leader, the TV host started to receive backlash.

However, it seems The Good Place star had her back at the time, as she reached out to Ellen and called her ‘incredibly strong’ for how she handled the controversy.

Since then, fans have questioned the actress’s knowledge of Bush’s reign and started questioning her about the Iraq war.

Deleting the tweet regarding Ellen, Jameela has since shared another post explaining her ignorance of the situation.

Jameela Jamil remains unapologetic for not knowing about George Bush’s history (Picture: MEGA)

She wrote: ‘Ooooof learning today about the full extent of Bush’s heinous presidency…

‘We weren’t taught much about him at school, we just heard he was stupid…(we were dealing with our own epic nightmare of a prime minister back then).

‘What a monstrous leader. I now understand the rage…’

She then went onto share a string of videos where she slammed her followers who came for her during the drama.

George hung out with Ellen (Picture: Getty Images)

‘So I see some grown adults are trying to shame me for having said I don’t know much about George Bush’s presidency,’ she said before adding: ‘Even though I’m trying to learn.’

The star continued: ‘And they seem to find it very unacceptable that I don’t have all the answers. Well, I’m sorry, I’m not ashamed I didn’t know, because I didn’t know yet, I was busy learning about other things.

‘Sometimes it depends on the environment in which you grow up in.’

Jameela added: ‘I don’t come from a politically minded family, I was really sick as a child, didn’t read, our school didn’t talk about American politics either, and the news used to make fun of George Bush so we just thought he was an idiot.

Jameela slammed her shamers (Picture: Getty Images)

‘We didn’t know that he was a serious war criminal back then, really only learning about the full extent of it now while learning about a load of other world politics I haven’t come across because they’re existing in places I haven’t been to.

Advertisement

‘The world is a mess there’s a lot to learn, we also need to learn about the environment, feminism, and race, and religion, and culture, and trans experiences, and gender, so much information to update ourselves on.’

Addressing how she has been ‘dragged’ for trying to expand her knowledge, the radio presenter continued to insist the ‘hate’ is not healthy for her young followers to see.

‘This isn’t progressive,’ she said: ‘I only talk about progress and not perfection because I think that is our only shot in this world.’

Jameela added: ‘I get it, I get feeling hurt when someone is ignorant to your personal situation, I’m a brown woman, an activist, I come across it every day.

‘But I chose to not think of it as malicious all the time, sometimes I just think you’re a product of your own environment and you’ll get there when you can.’
